precautions.Dengue: Use mosquito repellent, wear long-sleeved clothing, and eliminate mosquito breeding sites.
precautions.Malaria: Take anti-malarial medication, use mosquito nets, and avoid going out during peak mosquito hours.

precautions.Influenza: Get vaccinated, wash hands frequently, and avoid close contact with sick people.
precautions.Pneumonia: Get vaccinated, wash hands frequently, and don't smoke.

precautions.Typhoid: Get vaccinated, eat and drink only safe food and water, and wash hands frequently.
precautions.Hepatitis A: Get vaccinated, wash hands frequently, and eat and drink only safe food and water.

precautions.Chikungunya: Use mosquito repellent, wear long-sleeved clothing, and eliminate mosquito breeding sites.
precautions.Dengue: Use mosquito repellent, wear long-sleeved clothing, and eliminate mosquito breeding sites.

precautions.Scrub Typhus: Avoid contact with infected chiggers, use insect repellent, and wear protective clothing.
precautions.Leptospirosis: Avoid contact with contaminated water, wear protective clothing, and get vaccinated.

precautions.Japanese Encephalitis: Get vaccinated, use mosquito repellent, and wear long-sleeved clothing.
precautions.Malaria: Take anti-malarial medication, use mosquito nets, and avoid going out during peak mosquito hours.

precautions.Acute Respiratory Infection: Wash hands frequently, avoid close contact with sick people, and get vaccinated.
precautions.Diarrhoeal Diseases: Drink safe water, wash hands frequently, and eat properly cooked food.
